comments:
Using RC1, I could not run an ant script anymore. I have run it for months and
now it doesn't work anymore.
I get this exception in the .log file:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/tools/ant/BuildException
	at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredConstructors0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredConstructors(Class.java:1590)
	at java.lang.Class.getConstructor0(Class.java:1762)
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Class.java:276)
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:259)
	at org.eclipse.ant.core.AntRunner.run(AntRunner.java:267)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.internal.ant.launchConfigurations.AntLaunchDelegate$1.run(AntLaunchDelegate.java:170)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

I have the default settings on the ant runtime preference page.
The script is the following:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<!-- build script to create a batch compiler from org.eclipse.jdt.core -->
<project name="Eclipse Batch Compiler" default="export" basedir="..">
	<target name="init">
		<tstamp/>
		<property name="destdir" value="../../batchcompiler-export" />
		<property name="dest"  value="${destdir}" />
	</target>

	<target name="export" depends="init">

		<echo message="TARGET: ${destdir}" />
		<mkdir dir="${destdir}" />
		<delete dir="${dest}" />
		<mkdir dir="${dest}" />

		<echo message="UPDATE jdtcom.jar" />
		<jar 
			jarfile="${dest}/jdtcom.jar"
			basedir="bin"
		
includes="org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/**,org/eclipse/jdt/core/compiler/*" />
		
		<echo message="UPDATE jdtcomsrc.zip" />
		<zip zipfile="${dest}/jdtcomsrc.zip">
		    <zipfileset dir="batch" />
		    <zipfileset dir="compiler" />
  		</zip>		
	
	</target>
</project>

Some other scripts are still working fine. I don't understand why this one
doesn't work.

The launch config for this build doesn't have custom classpath that is out of 
date? Running the build file here works as expected.

Ok, I guess you can close it. I remove the existing ant configuration and 
create a new one. It works again. Sorry for the trouble. I was confused by the 
fact that I never needed to update the launching configuration in the past.
